{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3598617,"name":"Murilo Miranda Santos","username":"murilo404","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/49beb7/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-21T15:39:21.867Z","cooked":"

Good morning! I am a programmer on an FRC team and during this season, REEFSCAPE, my team came to use elements that we had never seen before, since we are a somewhat new team. I would like to know if your team also had any electrical or programming resources or strategies that they had not used before, if so, what was it? How was it used? How did it impact your robot? I thank you in advance for your answer.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-04-21T15:39:21.867Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":152,"readers_count":151,"score":100.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":500005,"topic_slug":"programming-and-eletric","display_username":"Murilo Miranda Santos","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69705,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/programming-and-eletric/500005/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3598625,"name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","username":"ngreen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-21T15:45:30.555Z","cooked":"

We attempted using WPICal this year. It is a nice tool developed in part by the Holy Cows 1538 to aid in building an accurate field map. We abandoned using it however just because we found it better to rely upon individual field element tags rather than a complete field map, and that we weren’t especially skilled for making it work during the field calibration period (which at champs we were only given 15 minutes the first time).

Anyhow, I think it is an excellent new tool and hope to continue to use it. I would maybe suggest that each event field find a way to aid in using this tool in the future. I think field calibration time is so short and busy to capture the needed videos. Maybe some of the mapping could be standardized each game and then each field could provide videos to all teams in advance, so that they can film without a really busy field full of people and robots. Just my two thoughts.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-04-21T15:45:30.555Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":143,"readers_count":142,"score":33.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":500005,"topic_slug":"programming-and-eletric","display_username":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":2695,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/programming-and-eletric/500005/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3598626,"name":"Benjamin Miller ","username":"BenjaminMiller","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/benjaminmiller/{size}/193876_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-21T15:46:03.454Z","cooked":"

We’ve used new things every year for me. 2022 transferred everything from LABView to Java. 2023 used swerve drive for the first time. Also used Pathplanner. 2024 we had some vision but our drivers did not use it as much. Mostly a team rebuild year. 2025 mechanically nothing changed but we had new pose estimation with Limelight. Rn we are working on implementing Advantage Scope/Kit. Strategy wise: on the programming side, read all the documentation twice. There is so much stuff that goes into everything. Electoral wise, get it as early as possible and learn its ins and out. Hopefully this helped!!

I tried out wpical at every event I went to, and got a lot of nice 4k photos on my iphone, although it took some time to find an open field during calibration period of course.
In my testing it didn’t really give anything close to accurate, I think the problem was that I used the wpical camera calibration which I think someone in the discord said was broken? [citation needed].

one of the generated atfls I got1011×621 85.8 KB

My plan was to share a qr code or something at the venue with the generated atfl, but of course it wasn’t accurate enough to warrant that. I’d be curious to hear if you guys got anything accurate out of it, I’d like to try it again once I can get a known good camera calibration.

Our main programming goal this season was to get vision working through a Limelight 3, and as an extension, PathPlanner and an auto-align system. Sadly, we never had a consistent enough auto-align for the system to be worth using. (During off-season, we’re going to be redoing much of the software on the robot, and we’ve already started on better aligning)

It may not have worked well this season, but it did let us work with autonomous routines, which makes me incredibly happy.

We also worked with AdvantageScope in a small capacity, and used it during an event to let visitors drive the robot in simulation.
